content.description: This climb is a little hard to get to and the bottom isn't as good as the top but the finishing crack is amazing. Starts on a ledge and follows some right facing flakes up underneath a wide roof. Plug a #5 or #6 and work right and then back left just below a perfect right facing corner.
content.protection: Gear, rap from webbing on tree
content.location: This climb is located on a point just to the left of a large wide chimney, Go left to find a breakdown to gain the ledge to start the climb

content.description: This is the long stretch of cliff bands that are south facing on the northern rim of the valley. Starting from across the Tacket Creek Wall the wall breaks up and has long stretches of tall exposed cliff bands. This area can be more difficult to navigate and requires some effort to get to the walls, but has some rewarding views from atop any climb.
